results.title: What price water
results.creator_credit: David Cons, G. Buckland-Smith and GBS Productions
results.brief_description: Britain is the leading exporter of desalination plants. All over the world plants are providing fresh water for consumption by industry, agriculture and in the home. Details the extensive research and development programmes on a number of techniques: multi-stage flash distillation, electrodialysis, reverse osmosis and freezing.

results.title: What now?
results.creator_credit: Mark Nebauer, Pregnancy Problem Centre and True Colours Productions
results.brief_description: Using real interviews and mock footage, this short film explores the issue of unwanted pregnancy with a slight slant towards pro-choice. Marion, Linda and Jody, three women of varying ages and from different backgrounds, talk candidly of what it was like to find themselves unexpectedly pregnant, the choices they made; abortion, adoption, keeping the baby, and how it has affected their lives today. Doctor Carolyn Russell discusses the emotional and physical phases of pregnancy as well as a brief overview of what goes on in an abortion. A guide accompanies the video to promote discussion.

results.title: What do you mean I've changed?: journeys through post-natal depression
results.brief_description: One in five women suffer from Post-natal depression (PND). In this short documentary, 3 women; Cindy Picton-Barnes, Susan King and Sandi Avery frankly discuss their experiences with PND - the physical and mental symptoms, self-doubt, fear and anxiety, and the treatment they found most effective. Also includes discussion with the womens’ partners and an expert from the Dona Maria Pre and Post-natal Support Network who outlines where women can go for help as well as what factors contribute to PND. Presented by Wendy Harmer, Patron of Dona Maria Post-Natal Support Network.

results.title: What do they read?
results.brief_description: Film stars with a room at the British Public Library and its request systems. Goes on to show old bibles then shows printing for hand bibles of the ‘50s.

results.title: What do I know about Benny?
results.brief_description: Benny is achieving low grades in school and his discipline is poor. His mother discuses the situation with the school principal. The principal attempts to explain that Benny was achieving up to his ability level. The mother rejects this and blames his performance on bad teaching.

results.title: What are words worth: copyright, CAL & sampling
results.creator_credit: Barry Jacobs, Copyright Agency Ltd and Serious Business TV Production
results.brief_description: The purpose of copyright is to protect the intellectual property of writers thus ensuring they are given the renumeration to which they are entitled. This program explains copyright issues such as the function of CAL and why it conducts copying surveys, the importance of copyright protection not only for authors but the whole community and the advantages of a centralised licensing and CAL sampling system. The program uses role play with actors to impart the important message about copyright.

results.title: What's in a symbol?
results.creator_credit: Gyorgy Karpati and League of Red Cross Societies et al
results.brief_description: A documentary of the history and activities of the Red Cross from its foundation in 1859 to the present day. Emphasises its role in providing help and protection to citizens worldwide. Depicts delegates and volunteers at work in war zones, assisting refugees and prisoners, tracing families and working with the urban poor and drug addicts.

results.title: Octopus octopus
results.creator_credit: Les Requins Associes and Metromedia Producers Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Narrated by Rod Serling. This cinematic companion to Cousteau’s book, “Octopus and Squid: The Soft Intelligence” seeks to dispel some long standing misapprehension’s about this gorgeous aquatic chameleon. Fantastic underwater cinematography attests to the octopus’ fluid grace and delicate sensuality. In the Mediterranean Sea, Captain Cousteau and his divers explore the underwater world of the octopus. He demonstrates that it is a small creature of great shyness. In a laboratory tank we see the courtship and breeding of a male and female, and the octopus embryos are followed through the remarkable process of birth. Cast includes Jacques Cousteau.

results.title: The Night of the squid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Sea Arrow Squids gather in large masses during their annual mating frenzy. The males transfer packets of sperm from their bodies to that of the female by using a specially adapted tentacle. The female attaches the fertilised egg clusters to the sea bottom where they hatch in approximately 28 days. Commentary by Rod Serling.

results.title: Sunken treasure
results.creator_credit: Jacques Cousteau Productions and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Shows Jacques Cousteau and his crew exploring the site of a wreck believed to be the command ship of the 1641 New World Armada. Also shows the crew testing some new ideas about underwater archaeological salvaging techniques. Suitable for upper secondary level.
